post.Title: Java desktop links of the week, October 16
post.Content:
Sorry about the lack of links last week. With everyone returning from JavaOne there wasn't a great deal of news, so I decided to carry it over a week. But, here we go - enjoy :-)

  • I was very pleased to share the news that ControlsFX won a Dukes Choice award at JavaOne.
  • Gerrit Grunwald has returned to the land of UIs :-) and has a blog post about another of his 'Friday Fun' components. Gerrit has also updated his TilesFX dashboard project, and posted a video of the current offering - it's very nice.
  • Mario Ivankovits has posted a build of Java 9 with JavaFX for Raspberry Pi.
  • Renato Athaydes has two things this week: firstly, a post on 'Say no to Electron! Using JavaFX to write a fast, responsive desktop application.' He also has updated LogFX, a "simple log reader supporting color highlighting and able to handle giant files".
  • I came across AgroSense this past week - an "open source farm managament and precision agriculture solution" written with JavaFX.
